page.title: 04WILD ANIMALS
page.content: In{Piethorne valley}there are some {kissing gates}with two latches on either side.These stop{sheep}from mixing together because the sheep have worked out a way to get through. There is a wood in Piethorne called {Bluebell Wood.}We know that there are {wood mice}there because the warden put some{mammal traps}out and he caught one. One person thought they saw a {squirrel.}We found some{owl pellets}so there must be owls living in the wood. People used to keep food fresh by using{corn cellers.}In Piethorne there are ruins of an{old inn}where people used to buy{beer wine and spirits.}A {fresh horse}would also be rented for the journey over the moors. There is an old{Packhorse bridge}which carries the{Rapes Way}but you can only see it when the{reservoirs}are{low.} J/R/5/6/85
